009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Collection;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.Comparator;
018import java.util.HashSet;
019import java.util.LinkedList;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Set;
022
023import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
024
025/**
026 * This class represents a connected component (i.e., a binary image region).
027 * Instances of this class form the nodes of a {@link ComponentTree}.
028 *
029 * @param <T> the type of properties that can be attached to instances of this class
030 */
031public class Component<T> {
032        
033        /** The ID number of this component (only used for debugging). */
034        public final int ID;
035        
036        // ------------------------------------------------------------
037        
038        private final int level;                                // intensity level associated with this region
039        private final List<Pixel> points;               // local points in this component (does not include points in child components) 
040        private int size;                                               // the total size of this component (number of points, includes children) 
041        
042        private Component<T> parent;                    // reference to the parent component (null if this is the root)
043        private Component<T> shortcut;                  // reference to a component in the same tree but closer to the root
044        private final Set<Component<T>> children; // the components at the next lower level
045        private int height;                                             // the height of the sub-tree rooted at this component
046        
047        private T properties = null;                    // additional component properties to be attached
048
049        // ------------------------------------------------------------
050        
051        /**
052         * Constructor.
053         * @param level the maximum pixel value in this component
054         * @param id a unique component id (assigned by the factory)
055         */
056        protected Component(int level, int id) {
057                this.ID = id;
058                this.level = level;
059                this.points = new LinkedList<>();
060                this.parent = null;
061                this.shortcut = null;
062                this.children = new HashSet<>();
063                this.size = 0;
064                this.height = 0;
065        }
066        
067        // --------------------------------------------------------
068        
069        /**
070         * Returns the parent component of this component ({@code null} if 
071         * this node is the tree's root).
072         * @return the parent component
073         */
074        public Component<T> getParent() {
075                return parent;
076        }
077
078        void setParent(Component<T> parent) {
079                this.parent = parent;
080                this.shortcut = parent;
081        }
082        
083        void addToSize(int sizeInc) {
084                size = size + sizeInc;
085        }
086        
087        /**
088         * Returns the size (number of pixels) of this component.
089         * @return the size of this component
090         */
091        public int getSize() {
092                return size;
093        }
094        
095        void addChild(Component<T> c) {
096                children.add(c);
097        }
098        
099        /**
100         * Returns the list of this component's child components.
101         * @return a (possibly empty) list of components, never {@code null}
102         */
103        public Collection<Component<T>> getChildren() {
104                if (children == null) {
105                        return Collections.emptyList();
106                }
107                else {
108                        return children;
109                }
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Returns the level (max. gray value) of this component.
114         * @return the component's level
115         */
116        public int getLevel() {
117                return this.level;
118        }
119        
120        void addPoint(Pixel p) {
121                points.add(p);
122                size = size + 1;
123        }
124        
125        /**
126         * Returns the height of the sub-tree which this component is the root of.
127         * @return the height of the sub-tree rooted by this component
128         */
129        public int getHeight() {
130                return this.height;
131        }
132        
133        void setHeight(int newHeight) {
134                height = newHeight;
135        }
136        
137        /**
138         * Returns a list of "local" pixels that directly belong to this component
139         * All these pixels have the same 'level' as the component itself.
140         * @return the component's local pixels
141         */
142        public Collection<Pixel> getLocalPixels() {
143                return this.points;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Returns a collection of all pixels of this component,
148         * including the component's local pixels
149         * and the pixels of all child components.
150         * Not needed in actual code, used only for debugging.
151         * @return all pixels contained in this component
152         */
153        public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
154                Collection<Pixel> compPoints = this.getChildPixels();
155                compPoints.addAll(this.points);
156                return compPoints;
157        }
158        
159//      public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
160//              Collection<Pixel> allPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
161//              allPoints.addAll(this.points);
162//              allPoints.addAll(this.getChildPixels());
163//              return allPoints;
164//      }
165        
166        /**
167         * Returns a collection of all pixels contained in the
168         * children of this component.
169         * @return all pixels from child components
170         */
171        public Collection<Pixel> getChildPixels() {
172                Collection<Pixel> childPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
173                for (Component<T> child : this.children) {
174                        childPoints.addAll(child.getAllPixels());
175                }
176                return childPoints;
177        }
178        
179        /**
180         * Sets the properties of this component.
181         * @param properties a property object (of type T)
182         */
183        public void setProperties(T properties) {
184                this.properties = properties;
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Returns the properties attached to this component.
189         * @return the properties attached to this component
190         */
191        public T getProperties() {
192                return properties;
193        }
194        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
195        
196        /**
197         * Recursively locates the root of the tree that contains this component,
198         * returning the first ancestor node that has no parent, which my be this
199         * node itself. 
200         * The {@link #shortcut} field is used to quickly move up to nodes closer to
201         * the root. The {@link #shortcut} field is updated "on the way back", i.e.,
202         * by the unwinding recursion.
203         * 
204         * @return the root of the sub-tree containing this component 
205         */
206        Component<T> findRoot() {
207                if (this.isRoot()) {
208                        return this;
209                }
210                else {
211                        shortcut = shortcut.findRoot(); // unwinding recursion updates shortcut 
212                        return shortcut;
213                }
214        }
215        
216        /**
217         * Returns {@code true} if this component is the root of the associated {@link ComponentTree}.
218         * @return {@code true} if this component is the root
219         */
220        public boolean isRoot() {       // TODO: change/clean/check!
221                return parent == null; // || this.parent == this;
222        }
223        
224        /**
225         * Returns {@code true} if this component represents an extremal region.
226         * @return {@code true} if the component is extremal
227         */
228        public boolean isExtremal() {
229                return isRoot() || parent.level > this.level;
230        }
231        
232        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
233        
234//      @Override
235//      public int compareTo(Component<?> other) {
236//              return Integer.compare(this.level, other.level);
237//      }       
238        
239        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
240        
241        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
242        private String listChildIds() {
243                int[] ids = new int[this.children.size()];
244                int i = 0;
245                for (Component<T> child : children) {
246                        ids[i] = child.ID;
247                        i++;
248                }
249                return Arrays.toString(ids);
250        }
251        
252        
253        /**
254         * Sorts a list of Components by (decreasing) component size, i.e.,
255         * the largest component (with the most pixels) becomes the first.
256         * 
257         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
258         */
259        public static void sortBySize(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
260                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
261                        @Override
262                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
263                                return Integer.compare(mser2.getSize(), mser1.getSize());
264                        }
265                };
266                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
267        }
268        
269        /**
270         * Sorts a list of Components by (increasing) component level, i.e.,
271         * the component with the lowest level becomes the first.
272         * 
273         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
274         */
275        public static void sortByLevel(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
276                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
277                        @Override
278                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
279                                return Integer.compare(mser1.level, mser2.level);
280                        }
281                };
282                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
283        }
284        
285
286        // ---------------------------
287        
288//      public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
289//              strm.format("Component %d(%d): size=%d locPts=%d chldPts=%d allPts=%d parent=%s shortcut=%s children=%s extrml=%b", 
290//                              this.ID, this.level, 
291//                              this.size,
292//                              this.points.size(),
293//                              this.getChildPoints().size(),
294//                              this.getAllPoints().size(),
295//                              (this.parent == null) ? "x" : (this.parent.ID + "(" + this.parent.level + ")"),
296//                              (this.shortcut == null) ? "x" : (this.shortcut.ID + "(" + this.shortcut.level + ")"),
297//                              //this.findRoot().ID,
298//                              this.listChildIds(),
299//                              this.isExtremal()
300//                              );
301//      }
302        
303        void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
304                strm.format("Component %d(%d): size=%d locPts=%d chldPts=%d allPts=%d parent=%s",
305                                this.ID, this.level, 
306                                this.size,
307                                this.points.size(),
308                                this.getChildPixels().size(),
309                                this.getAllPixels().size(),
310                                (this.parent == null) ? "x" : (this.parent.ID + "(" + this.parent.level + ")")
311                                );
312        }
313        
314        @Override
315        public String toString() {
316                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
317                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
318                this.printToStream(ps);
319                return os.toString();
320        }
321        
322//      public String toStringShort() {
323//              return String.format("%d(%d)", ID, level);
324//      }
